definitions.definition: to some extent but not very
definitions.labels: North American EnglishBritish EnglishBritish EnglishNorth American English

examples.text: It's **fairly obvious** what's going on here.
It's fairly clear that there is still room for improvement.
I know him fairly well, but I wouldn't say we were really close friends.
We'll have to leave fairly soon *(= before very long)*.
I'm fairly certain I can do the job.
He was fairly sure he was right.
I think you'll find it fairly difficult *(= you do not want to say that it is very difficult)*.
The restaurant was fairly close to my hotel.
The software is fairly easy to use.

definitions.definition: in a fair and reasonable way; honestly

examples.text: Her attitude could fairly be described as hostile.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize something that you are saying
honestly and according to the rules
in a direct way that is easy to understand
exactly in the place you were aiming for
